title: Falklands War veteran to bring life story tour back to Hampshire by popular demand
text:
1 comment 
FALKLAND'S War Veteran, author and public speaker, Simon Weston OBE has this year, for the first time ever, taken to the stage to tell his no holds barred story as part of his UK tour of My Life; My Story. 
Due to the response he received on his recent Hampshire date, Simon will be returning to Hanger Farm Arts Centre in Totton in 2016. 
From his own unique perspective, Simon will share shocking truths with close friend and former Sky News anchor David Fitzgerald about the conflict, about the day the RFA Sir Galahad was attacked and about the impact the event and its consequences have had since. 
It was the conflict of a generation and a time that many will never forget. On the 2nd of April 1982 Argentina invaded the Falklands Islands, with the aim of recapturing them through a claim that they had inherited the islands from Spain in the 1800's. 
The Islands, which had been controlled by Great Britain for nearly 150 years, became a battle ground and the UK government were quick to defend both the Islands and its inhabitants. What was to follow saw the deaths of 655 Argentine Soldiers and 255 British Serviceman. 
Amongst those who were sent to the conflict was Simon. In one of the most horrific moments of the conflict the RFA Sir Galahad was bombed by two Argentine planes, 48 servicemen lost their lives and very few survived. Among these survivors was Simon. This was an event which would change his life forever. 
Eventually, and against the odds, Simon escaped the burning and buckled ship but only after suffering 46% burns to his body. Since then he has become one of the most recognised faces of the conflict. 
Simon Weston; My Life, My Story is a truly inspirational show about one manâ€™s journey from the front line of war, being on the edge of death, to today, being a happy and contented father, grandfather and national treasure. Share article 
The Totton date, on Saturday February 27, is among a string of new dates for 2016.
